title: Math ops support for float64
body_html:
I am raising this issue following this stackoverflow discussion. I found that there is not that much support for float64 ops, that is needed for some numerical applications. A number of other issues #1061 #761 #547 and PR #1089 have been raised around this.

On the basis of how my graph is initialised, things like MatMul (also raised in this other stackoverflow question), Mean, L2Loss, Mean_grad/Prod, Mul_grad/Sum, AddN, SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogits are not implemented for float64.

Would it be a good idea to extend PR #1089 to more ops?

body:
I am raising this issue following [this stackoverflow discussion](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35443080/tensorflow-critical-graph-operations-assigned-to-cpu-rather-than-gpu?lq=1). I found that there is not that much support for float64 ops, that is needed for some numerical applications. A number of other issues  #1061 #761 #547 and PR #1089 have been raised around this.

On the basis of how my graph is initialised, things like **MatMul** (also raised in this other [stackoverflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35428297/tensorflow-issue-with-gpu-on-matmul-gpu-isnt-recognized?lq=1)), **Mean, L2Loss, Mean_grad/Prod, Mul_grad/Sum, AddN, SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogits** are not implemented for float64.

Would it be a good idea to extend PR #1089 to more ops?
